fields.description:
*Assessment*

While verifying EUCA-12779, it was noticed that when the ELB had 1 out of 3 back-end instances registered with an {{InService}} state, any query against the ELB returned a 503. Eventually, a 200 code was returned:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euform-describe-stacks --region devops-admin@
STACK	EUCA12779Stack	CREATE_COMPLETE		CloudFormation template to deploy an instance and a 3 availability zone ELB, Nginx deployment on Eucalyptus VPC cloud	2017-02-14T18:54:21.619Z
PARAMETER	ImageId		emi-63ef779d
PARAMETER	KeyName		devops-admin
PARAMETER	EndPoint		http://cloudformation.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.medium
PARAMETER	MinSize		3
PARAMETER	MaxSize		6
OUTPUT	InstanceId	i-61c22b22
OUTPUT	ElasticIP	10.116.152.80
OUTPUT	AllocationID	eipalloc-26c21e26
OUTPUT	NetworkInterfaceId	eni-b36e2132
OUTPUT	EIPAssociationId	eipassoc-d7a00541
OUTPUT	AccessLogBucket	euca12779stack-s3loggingbucket-tmrw0xsa26rcp
OUTPUT	ELBURL	http://EUCA12779-NginxELB-CTX1C5AMLUG9K-000727120439.lb.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
[root@h-04 ~]# eulb-describe-lbs --region devops-admin@
LOAD_BALANCER	EUCA12779-NginxELB-CTX1C5AMLUG9K	EUCA12779-NginxELB-CTX1C5AMLUG9K-000727120439.lb.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	2017-02-14T18:54:32.700Z	internet-facing
[root@h-04 ~]# eulb-describe-instance-health EUCA12779-NginxELB-CTX1C5AMLUG9K --region devops-admin@
INSTANCE	i-6aaebf28	OutOfService
INSTANCE	i-a8a39e87	OutOfService
INSTANCE	i-6125e4a4	InService
[root@h-04 ~]# curl -I http://EUCA12779-NginxELB-CTX1C5AMLUG9K-000727120439.lb.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
HTTP/1.1 503 Service Unavailable
Content-Length: 0
Connection: close
[root@h-04 ~]# curl -I http://EUCA12779-NginxELB-CTX1C5AMLUG9K-000727120439.lb.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
HTTP/1.1 503 Service Unavailable
Content-Length: 0
Connection: close
[root@h-04 ~]# curl -I http://EUCA12779-NginxELB-CTX1C5AMLUG9K-000727120439.lb.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
HTTP/1.1 503 Service Unavailable
Content-Length: 0
Connection: close
[root@h-04 ~]# curl -I http://EUCA12779-NginxELB-CTX1C5AMLUG9K-000727120439.lb.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
HTTP/1.1 503 Service Unavailable
Content-Length: 0
Connection: close
[root@h-04 ~]# curl -I http://EUCA12779-NginxELB-CTX1C5AMLUG9K-000727120439.lb.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.10.0 (Ubuntu)
Date: Tue, 14 Feb 2017 18:57:42 GMT
Content-Type: text/html
Content-Length: 424469
Last-Modified: Tue, 14 Feb 2017 18:56:32 GMT
ETag: "58a352e0-67a15"
Accept-Ranges: bytes

{code}

*Steps*

# Set up Eucalyptus VPC cloud with multiple availability zones - [hspencer-400-maint-4.4|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint_4.4/400/]
# Using linked {{cfn-elb-multiaz-accesslog-cloudwatch-instance-vpc.json}} template, create stack
# After stack reaches {{CREATE_COMPLETE}}, list the instance health of the ELB. Once one of the instances reaches {{InService}}, query the ELB DNS URL.
fields.summary: Multi-AZ ELB returns 503 when one out of three backend instances are in 'InService' state
fields.environment: Eucalyptus VPC with multiple availability zones

comments.body: Please, investigate the scope of this problem, [~spark]. Do not pursue a fix unless it is something trivial.

The issue filed here is not very critical, but it is actually related to a more critical issue.

The issue is that there are some enabled AZs where there is no registered instances. If cross-zone loadbalancing is turned on (in the test above), eventually all loadbalancers will forward traffics to backend instances and continue to return 200. It takes up to 1 minute until loadbalancers settle.

The critical issue is when cross-zone loadbalancing is turned off (default). DNS resolver's response includes haproxy where there is no backend instances registered with it and it returns 503. The fix should be either:
1) include ELB VMs in DNS response only if there are backend instances registered with the AZ, or cross-zone LB is turned on. This fix is easy.

2) Haproxy in the AZ where there is no registered backend instances should forward traffics to instances in other AZ even if cross-zone AZ is not turned on. A quick test on AWS seems to indicate that this is their implementation.

I think it is easy and safe to do 1) in 4.4. 
[~dmitrii] [~tony] Let me know if you want to include the fix for 4.4. I'll get the fix ready by tomorrow.
[~spark], does #1 have any impact on EUCA-13236? (could we kill 2 birds with 1 stone)
[~tony] EUCA-13236 is not a bug. It's the expected behavior and not related to this one.

[~spark] and [~dmitrii],

Do both solutions result in the same behavior? I think ultimately we should have the same behavior as AWS. If the second option gets us AWS behavior then I would push for us to punt this from 4.4.0 and do that fix in 4.4.1. I would hate to do rushed work and vetting of a fix for 4.4.0 then have more work on the same issue in 4.4.1 to deliver the complete solution.
Actually there is an issue with approach #1 in single AZ situation. So I agree w/ [~tony].

[~hspencer] Would you be willing to test the change? The fix was pushed to maint-4.4.
After the fix, the expected behavior in both cross-zone LB and non cross-zone:

1) When an instance is deregistered and the zone has no available instance, the loadbalancer should continue 200 response.

2) When an instance goes OutOfService (i.e., web server dies, etc), the loadbalancer will temporarily return 503, but eventually return 200 (can take up to 60 seconds).

Also it would be great if you can run through comprehensive ELB test, as the change touches the critical path of all ELB functionality (I did my self, but to make sure....)

[~spark], while confirming the fix, I didn't get the behavior you mentioned in scenario #2.  Correct me if I am wrong, but my ELB had a health check interval of 90 seconds with an unhealthy count of 7 (around 10.5 minutes).  When the instance goes into "OutOfService", then I should see in my curl tests the 503 HTTP responses end around 11.5 minutes.  In my testing, I saw 503 HTTP responses for 26 minutes. Steps I followed are below:

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.4.0-0.25876.33.20170412git5f0e510.el7}}

*Steps*

# Deploy Eucalyptus 4.4 VPC cloud with multiple AZs - [hspencer-672-maint-4.4|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint_4.4/672/]
# Create non-eucalyptus account (e.g. {{development-operations}})
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# euare-accountcreate -a development-operations -w > .euca/devops-admin.ini
{code}
# Create and import keypair
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "Developement Operations Admin Key"
[root@a-16-l ~]# euca-import-keypair -f devops-admin-pk.pub devops-admin --region devops-admin@
KEYPAIR	devops-admin	b8:ea:b0:d4:d4:40:26:5f:14:91:ba:a9:05:20:9d:72
{code}
# Bundle, upload and register Ubuntu Xenial Cloud image:
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# euca-describe-images --all --region devops-admin@
IMAGE	emi-d64c38f0	ubuntu-xenial-x86_64-hvm-20170413/xenial-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.manifest.xml	000756474874	available	public	x86_64	machine   				instance-store	hvm
{code}
# Create stack using linked {{cfn-elb-twoaz-accesslog-cloudwatch-instance-vpc.json}} template:
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# euform-create-stack EUCA13233Stack --template-file cfn-elb-twoaz-accesslog-cloudwatch-instance-vpc.json --parameter KeyName=devops-admin --parameter ImageId=emi-d64c38f0 --parameter EndPoint=http://cloudformation.b-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --region devops-admin@
arn:aws:cloudformation::000571701517:stack/EUCA13233Stack/eeca5fc5-c058-46fa-8d78-71a36bd4f8fc
[root@a-16-l ~]# euform-describe-stacks --region devops-admin@
STACK	EUCA13233Stack	CREATE_COMPLETE		CloudFormation template to deploy an instance and a 2 availability zone ELB, Nginx deployment on Eucalyptus VPC cloud	2017-04-18T17:23:44.238Z
PARAMETER	ImageId		emi-d64c38f0
PARAMETER	KeyName		devops-admin
PARAMETER	EndPoint		http://cloudformation.b-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.medium
PARAMETER	MinSize		2
PARAMETER	MaxSize		4
OUTPUT	InstanceId	i-8162f69d
OUTPUT	ElasticIP	10.116.131.220
OUTPUT	AllocationID	eipalloc-36a1ddc0
OUTPUT	NetworkInterfaceId	eni-bbcf4092
OUTPUT	EIPAssociationId	eipassoc-64173fdb
OUTPUT	AccessLogBucket	euca13233stack-s3loggingbucket-ol3rsvnqknj53
OUTPUT	ELBURL	http://EUCA13233-NginxELB-TXQ8W7V0OL8PG-000571701517.lb.b-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com

$ curl -I http://EUCA13233-NginxELB-TXQ8W7V0OL8PG-000571701517.lb.b-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.10.0 (Ubuntu)
Date: Tue, 18 Apr 2017 18:07:35 GMT
Content-Type: text/html
Content-Length: 438641
Last-Modified: Tue, 18 Apr 2017 17:28:11 GMT
ETag: "58f64cab-6b171"
Accept-Ranges: bytes
{code}
# Using AWS CLI, allow '(eucalyptus)loadbalancing' account to write to S3 bucket for access logging:
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# aws --endpoint-url=http://s3.b-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api put-bucket-acl --bucket euca13233stack-s3loggingbucket-ol3rsvnqknj53 --grant-write "id=000040221969" --profile devops-admin
[root@a-16-l ~]# aws --endpoint-url=http://s3.b-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api get-bucket-acl --bucket euca13233stack-s3loggingbucket-ol3rsvnqknj53 --profile devops-admin
{
    "Owner": {
        "DisplayName": "development-operations",
        "ID": "425e50453a405935135a4c515d4e475e4a16191c1e372d57a4d56184bd405436"
    },
    "Grants": [
        {
            "Grantee": {
                "Type": "CanonicalUser",
                "DisplayName": "development-operations",
                "ID": "425e50453a405935135a4c515d4e475e4a16191c1e372d57a4d56184bd405436"
            },
            "Permission": "FULL_CONTROL"
        },
        {
            "Grantee": {
                "Type": "CanonicalUser",
                "DisplayName": "(eucalyptus)loadbalancing",
                "ID": "2c5f4e5f334747542914253b313809222433205f4b1a2d63c6253263f2851447"
            },
            "Permission": "WRITE"
        }
    ]
}
{code}
# Start curl test:
{code}
$ while true; do curl -s -I http://EUCA13233-NginxELB-TXQ8W7V0OL8PG-000571701517.lb.b-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com; sleep 1; done > EUCA13233-curl-test.txt
{code}
# Change ASG capacity to one (tests having an ELB across multiple AZ, but one backend instance):
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# euscale-update-auto-scaling-group --desired-capacity 1 -m 1 EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW --region devops-admin@
[root@a-16-l ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --region devops-admin@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW	EUCA13233Stack-LaunchConfig-DTN66XV9CBI6G	black-dollar,black-market	EUCA13233-NginxELB-TXQ8W7V0OL8PG	1	4	1	Default
INSTANCE	i-ce2863fa	black-dollar	InService	Healthy	EUCA13233Stack-LaunchConfig-DTN66XV9CBI6G
TAG	auto-scaling-group	EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW	Name	EUCA13233Stack	true
TAG	auto-scaling-group	EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW	aws:cloudformation:logical-id	AutoScalingGroup	true
TAG	auto-scaling-group	EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW	aws:cloudformation:stack-id	arn:aws:cloudformation::000571701517:stack/EUCA13233Stack/eeca5fc5-c058-46fa-8d78-71a36bd4f8fc	true
TAG	auto-scaling-group	EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW	aws:cloudformation:stack-name	EUCA13233Stack	true
{code}
# After about 10 minutes, set capacity of ASG to where one instance will be in each AZ:
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# euscale-update-auto-scaling-group --desired-capacity 2 -m 2 EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW --region devops-admin@
[root@a-16-l ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --region devops-admin@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW	EUCA13233Stack-LaunchConfig-DTN66XV9CBI6G	black-dollar,black-market	EUCA13233-NginxELB-TXQ8W7V0OL8PG	2	4	2	Default
INSTANCE	i-13ae04fc	black-market	InService	Healthy	EUCA13233Stack-LaunchConfig-DTN66XV9CBI6G
INSTANCE	i-ce2863fa	black-dollar	InService	Healthy	EUCA13233Stack-LaunchConfig-DTN66XV9CBI6G
TAG	auto-scaling-group	EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW	Name	EUCA13233Stack	true
TAG	auto-scaling-group	EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW	aws:cloudformation:logical-id	AutoScalingGroup	true
TAG	auto-scaling-group	EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW	aws:cloudformation:stack-id	arn:aws:cloudformation::000571701517:stack/EUCA13233Stack/eeca5fc5-c058-46fa-8d78-71a36bd4f8fc	true
TAG	auto-scaling-group	EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW	aws:cloudformation:stack-name	EUCA13233Stack	true
{code}
# SSH into one of the instances and stop nginx (this will trigger instance to go to 'OutOfService' state once it reaches the health-check threshold):
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# euca-describe-instances i-13ae04fc --region devops-admin@
RESERVATION	r-ec545810	000571701517	EUCA13233Stack-InstanceSecurityGroup-7VE8M2JVDGFKS
INSTANCE	i-13ae04fc	emi-d64c38f0	euca-10-116-131-181.eucalyptus.b-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-0-1-155.eucalyptus.internal	running	devops-admin	0		m1.medium	2017-04-18T21:26:48.610Z	black-market				monitoring-enabled	10.116.131.181	10.0.1.155vpc-4fcaa016	subnet-ae27d79b	instance-store					hvm		5be5fda7-5dcd-41f1-aa5d-0c7a4ba31cce_black-market_1	sg-309e65ac		x86_64
NETWORKINTERFACE	eni-e884037a	subnet-ae27d79b	vpc-4fcaa016	000571701517	in-use	10.0.1.155	euca-10-0-1-155.eucalyptus.internal	true
ATTACHMENT		eni-attach-6bbc7853	0	attached	2017-04-18T21:26:48.614Z	true
ASSOCIATION	10.116.131.181		10.0.1.155
GROUP	sg-309e65ac	EUCA13233Stack-InstanceSecurityGroup-7VE8M2JVDGFKS
PRIVATEIPADDRESS	10.0.1.155	euca-10-0-1-155.eucalyptus.internal	primary
TAG	instance	i-13ae04fc	Name	EUCA13233Stack
TAG	instance	i-13ae04fc	aws:autoscaling:groupName	EUCA13233Stack-AutoScalingGroup-GEUKOK9GSYGAW
TAG	instance	i-13ae04fc	aws:cloudformation:logical-id	AutoScalingGroup
TAG	instance	i-13ae04fc	aws:cloudformation:stack-id	arn:aws:cloudformation::000571701517:stack/EUCA13233Stack/eeca5fc5-c058-46fa-8d78-71a36bd4f8fc
TAG	instance	i-13ae04fc	aws:cloudformation:stack-name	EUCA13233Stack

[root@a-16-l ~]# euca-authorize -P tcp -p ssh sg-309e65ac --region devops-admin@
GROUP	sg-309e65ac
PERMISSION	sg-309e65ac	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0
[root@a-16-l ~]# euca-authorize -P tcp -p ssh --egress sg-309e65ac --region devops-admin@
GROUP	sg-309e65ac
PERMISSION	sg-309e65ac	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0

[root@a-16-l ~]# ssh -i devops-admin-pk ubuntu@euca-10-116-131-181.eucalyptus.b-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
ubuntu@euca-10-0-1-155:~$ sudo service nginx stop
ubuntu@euca-10-0-1-155:~$ sudo systemctl status nginx
● nginx.service - A high performance web server and a reverse proxy server
   Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/nginx.service; enabled; vendor preset: enabled)
   Active: inactive (dead) since Tue 2017-04-18 21:37:03 UTC; 22s ago
  Process: 3915 ExecStop=/sbin/start-stop-daemon --quiet --stop --retry QUIT/5 --pidfile /run/nginx.pid (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)
 Main PID: 3383 (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)

Apr 18 21:28:55 euca-10-0-1-155 systemd[1]: Starting A high performance web server and a reverse proxy server...

Apr 18 21:37:03 euca-10-0-1-155 systemd[1]: Stopped A high performance web server and a reverse proxy server.
ubuntu@euca-10-0-1-155:~$ exit
{code}
# Confirm instance goes into 'OutOfService' state:
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# eulb-describe-instance-health EUCA13233-NginxELB-TXQ8W7V0OL8PG --region devops-admin@
INSTANCE	i-13ae04fc	OutOfService
INSTANCE	i-ce2863fa	InService
{code}
Looking at the health check for the ELB:
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# eulb-describe-lbs --region devops-admin@ --show-long
LOAD_BALANCER	EUCA13233-NginxELB-TXQ8W7V0OL8PG	EUCA13233-NginxELB-TXQ8W7V0OL8PG-000571701517.lb.b-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com			{interval=90,target=HTTP:80/,timeout=60,healthy-threshold=3,unhealthy-threshold=7}	black-market,black-dollar	subnet-ae27d79b,subnet-3817b98e	vpc-4fcaa016	i-13ae04fc,i-ce2863fa	{protocol=HTTP,lb-port=80,instance-port=80}					{owner-alias=000571701517,group-name=EUCA13233Stack-LoadBalancerSecurityGroup-PSFAAQBMKFKGW}	{sg-e2f1da72}	2017-04-18T17:24:41.686Z	internet-facing
{code}
The instance will take around 10.5 minutes to go to 'OutOfService'.  Based upon the fix, it should take 11.5 minutes for the 503 HTTP responses to end, however, it takes 26 minutes (See attached  EUCA13233-curl-test.txt file).  First 503 HTTP code shows at {{Date: Tue, 18 Apr 2017 21:20:48 GMT}}.  The last one is at {{Date: Tue, 18 Apr 2017 21:46:29 GMT}}. [^cfn-elb-twoaz-accesslog-cloudwatch-instance-vpc.json]
[~hspencer], your packages are a little stale. Besides euca packages, there is also an updated service image with servo v 1.4. Not sure if that would make a difference.

Nice work [~spark]. Works like a charm.

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.4.1-0.25878.35.20170413git36456cc.el7}}

*Steps*

# Deploy Eucalyptus 4.4.1 VPC cloud with multiple AZs - [hspencer-684-maint-4.4|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint_4.4/684/]
{code}
[root@c-36 ~]# euca-describe-availability-zones
AVAILABILITYZONE	black-dollar	available
AVAILABILITYZONE	black-market	available
{code}
# Create non-eucalyptus account (e.g. {{development-operations}})
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# euare-accountcreate -a development-operations -w > .euca/devops-admin.ini
{code}
# Create and import keypair
{code}
[root@a-16-l ~]# ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "Developement Operations Admin Key"
[root@a-16-l ~]# euca-import-keypair -f devops-admin-pk.pub devops-admin --region devops-admin@

{code}
# Bundle, upload and register Ubuntu Xenial Cloud image:
{code}
[root@c-36 ~]# euca-describe-images --region devops-admin@

{code}

{code}
